learnerpkg 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Function to create a sentence from individual words

    createSentence.Rd

    Setting up an R package is easy when using the RStudio GUI as as well as the R packages devtools, usethis, Rdpack, testhat, and roxygen. You can nicely document your functions, and easily share argument definitions across multiple functions with the roxygen @template tag. We can also make our documentation fancy by adding math, for example, like this: \(\sum_{i}^{n} x^i\).

    Usage

    createSentence(subject, adverb, verb, noun)

    Arguments

    subject

    The subject of the sentence. Choices are limited to 'I', 'You', 'She', 'He', 'They', and 'We'.

    adverb

    An optional word to modify the verb of the sentence.

    verb

    The word indicating what action is happening in the sentence.

    noun

    The word indicating the object to which the action is happening.

    Value

    Returns a complete sentence as a single string.

    References

    Wickham H (2015). R packages: organize, test, document, and share your code. " O'Reilly Media, Inc.".

    Examples

    subject = "I"
adverb = "happily"
verb = "walked"
noun = "home"
createSentence(subject, adverb, verb, noun)
#> [1] "I happily walked home."
